Ambres - A 3000 year old consciousness that speaks through a simple carpenter.

It was the mid 1970&#039;s, and Eastern styles of meditation were becoming popular throughout Europe and Sweden. Sture Johansson&#039;s wife joined a meditation group that he was reluctantly coaxed into attending. Sture couldn&#039;t understand how supposedly sane adult grownups found it necessary to close their eyes and block out the world to find peace and enlightenment. Being tired at the end of a long workday, he usually drifted off to sleep during these meditation sessions. One evening he suddenly woke up to find the entire group staring at him. He apologized for his behavior, thinking that he may have been snoring. &#039;You haven&#039;t been asleep&#039; was what he heard from several of them. &#039;Someone else took over your body&#039; Apparently, a voice completely different from his own, had stood up and announced to the group that Sture had been chosen to be an instrument of communication for a very special purpose. Sture was communicating with an entity called Ambres who lived 3000 years ago in Egypt.

Sture Johansson got his international reputation in the 80&#039;s when Shirley McLaine went to the little village in VÃƒÂ¤rmland/Sweden to meet Ambres, and then wrote about him in her autobiography &#039;Out On A Limb&#039;. She also shot some of the scenes here, for the movie with the same name. It created quite a stir in the media and since then Sture has avoided all publicity. But he felt confident with Anders GrÃƒÂ¶nros, when they met in 2003, and said yes to the making of this documentary.

Anders GrÃƒÂ¶nros seeks in this quiet documentary through his meeting with Sture and Ambres to understand what it is all about. He wants to challenge his own comprehension of reality and tell us about the phenomena without giving a certain answer - it is up to every person who sees the movie to form his or her own opinion. During an hour we get to alternately meet Sture, the simple carpenter in his everyday life, and Ambres that speaks straight into the camera about his message of self-knowledge. Ambres wants to help us find the beautiful wisdom we all carry deep inside, to see who we really are behind the roles we play. It is all different kinds of people - actors, businessmen, workers, doctors, priests - that on a regular basis meets with Ambres to be a part of his teachings of life.

Full DVD with menus including 72 min bonus material. Swedish with english subtitles. The DVD was shrinked from original size to DVD-5 format, in order to simplify burning (burn image) on a one-sided single-layer DVD disc (4.7GB). 
Ambres DVD (Ambres.iso) can also be mounted in a virtual drive, or opened and played by e.g. VideoLan (VLC Media Player).
